notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): Oratio de sancta maria matre domini.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): O dulcissima domina maria pietatis et misericordie

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: Explicit (Latin): Aue maria | gratia plena dominus tecum benedictum in multis

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: Latin

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): Deus qui beatum Thomam archipresulem | ab exilio reuocatum in ecclesia propria.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: Explicit (Latin): Per dominum nostrum Ihesum Amen.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: Latin

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 4v/1-2) AN anginn is ealra þingen. þæt is god | ælmihtig.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 6v/13-14) ˥ hine þæt gelogode. | ac he ƿearð þurh deofles sƿicdome ut adræ | fd

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Note
notes.body: Text ends mid-page.

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): (fol. 6v/14) Emb Clænnysse þe gehadede mæn healden scy | len

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 6v/15) Ælfric abbod gret Sigefryð.ʹ freondlice

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 6v/21-22) Nu secge ic þe leofe man þæt me is lað to tælen | ægne godes freond.ʹ gyf he godes riht drifð.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Note
notes.body: Fragment.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 7r/1-2) Mann sceal þurh his modes snoternysse | hine sylfre geglengen to ƿisre lare.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 11v/19-21) Ne nym þu medsceattes | for heo ablændeð ƿisra manna geðancas. ˥ ƿæn | deð rihtƿisra ƿord.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 12r/1-2) AN Scyppend is ealra þingen geseoƿenlicre | ˥ ungeseoƿenlicre.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 13v/6-7) For þan þe heo hæfeð | þry þing on hire untodælendlice ƿyrcende.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): (fol. 13v/8) Decalogum moysi.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 13v/9-10) ƿe sculen cunnen gemyndelice ˥ mannen eac | seggen. þa ten ælice ƿord þe god tæhte moysen.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 15r/18-19) ˥ us þe nu | synden.ʹ æfter christes acænnednysse.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): (fol. 15r/19-20) Dexii. abu | siuis secundem disputatione Sancti Cipriani martyris.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 15r/21-2) Nu synd tƿelf abusiua þæt synd tƿelf unðeaƿes | þe ƿe eoƿ secgeð onleden.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 21r/18-20) þæt hé ure faƿlen un | derfo. þe he asænde to þan lichamen. by him a | ƿuldor ˥ ƿurðmynt. amen.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): (fol. 21r/20) Devia. principalibis viciis.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 21r/21-22) Nu syndon ehte heafodlehtres þe us on ƿinneð | sƿyðe.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 22r/17-19) ˥ þone mann macað eac | gyf he modegað tofƿðe. þæs deofles gefere þe | feoll ær þurh heo.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): (fol. 22r/19) Devia. virtutibus.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 22r/20) Nu synden ehte heafodmægna.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 23v/20) ámid gode sylfen gyf þe sƿincað nu her.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): (fol. 23v/21) Of Sanctus Iohanne baptiste.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 23v/21-22) Se Godspellere lucas | aƿrat on cristes bech beo accænnednysse | jahes þæs fulhteres þuss cƿeðende.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 25r/12) Ofet hine fedde ˥ ƿude hunig. ˥ oðre ƿaclice þing.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): (fol. 25r/13) In Festo Sancti Petra apostoli.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 25r/13-15) Venit iesus in partes | cesaree philippi.ʹ ˥ reliqua. Matheus se godspel | lere aƿrat on þære godspellice gesettnysse þuss | cƿeðende.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 25v/11) þæt byð gebunden on heofone. ˥ sƿahƿætt sƿa þu unbinst | on eorðen; þæt byð unbunden on heofonen.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): (fol. 25v/12) Of Iacobe Iohannes broðer.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 25v/13-15) Ðæt iudeissce folc brohte þan hundredes eal | dren feo. for þy þæt heo mosten jacoben sƿa | ateon sƿa heo ƿolden.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 30r/9-10) ƿan sy ƿul | dor ˥ ƿurðmynt and on ealra ƿurlde ƿurld. amen.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): (fol. 30r/11) VI. kalendes Augusti. Sanctorum Septem Dormientium.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 30r/12-13) ƿe ƿylleð eoƿ eac gereccen seortlice þæt nu | æfter tƿam dagen is þære seofan slæpe | ran gemynd.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 31v/4-5) se þe leo | fað ˥ rixeð and on ecnysse. ameN.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): (fol. 31v/5-6) Kalendes Augusti. | Ad Vincula Sanctt Petri apostoli

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 31v/7-10) LVcas se godspellere us sæde on þyssen pistol | rædinge. þæt herodes king ƿolde æfter cristes | upstige to heofone gesƿæncen sume of þære ge | laðunge.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 33r/2-3) þiss ƿæs gedon on þysser nihte. | ˥ on þan andƿeardan dæge þe ƿe hateð hlafmæsse.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): (fol. 33r/4) Dominicaxi. post Pentecosten.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): (fol. 33r/5) Cum appropinuaret iesus ierusalem. ˥ reliqua. On summe | re tide ƿæs se hælend farende to ierusalem

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 40r/4-5) Seo þe lof | ˥ ƿuldor on ealra ƿurlda ƿurld. amen.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): (fol. 40r/5-6) Dominicaxii. | post Pentecosten.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): (fol. 40r/6-8) Dixit iesus ad | quosdam qui in se confidebant tanquam | iusti et aspernabantur ceteros parabolam istam ˥ reliqua.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 48v/9-10) oððæt se hae | lend crist to þussen life becom.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Note
notes.body: Concludes with the story of Daniel from Ælfric, 'De falsis diis' ed. Pope 1967-68, 693-703, no. 21, ll. 300-496.

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): (fol. 48v/10-11) In Assumptione | Sancte Marie.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 48v/11-13) IERonimus se halge sacerd aƿrat | ænne pistol beo forðsiðe þære eadigen marien | godes cænnestre. to sumen halgen mædene.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 54v/1-3) ˥ cƿæð þæt heo | him geðingod hæfde ƿið þone heofonlice deme hire | agene sune.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Note
notes.body: cf. fols 58r/1- 60r/18 below.

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): (fol. 54v/10) Omelia

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 54v/3-8) Mænn þa leofeste hƿi | lon ær ƿe gerehten eoƿ þone pistol þe se halge ieroni | mus sette beo forðsiðe þære eadigen marien christes | moder þurh þone he adƿæsete þa dƿollice gesettnysse | þe samlærede mæn sæden beo hire forðsiðe.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 57v/20-22) Synd sƿa | þeh get þa dƿollice bec æigðer gea on leden gea | on ænglisc.ʹ ˥ heo rædeð ungeræde mæn.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Note
notes.body: The explanatory note and pericope, fol. 54v/3-10, is written over an erased rubric and follows the preceding item without a break, but is followed by a red rubric at fol. 54v/10 and an enlarged and decorated coloured initial. Thus, Warner (1917 for 1915) edits this as a new text, but the manuscript textual divisions on fol. 54v are ambiguous, with a large initial 'S' apparent at line 54v:11, even though Warner's item begins at line 3 on fol. 54v, with the incipit as above.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 58r/1-2) ƿe ƿylleð eoƿ gereccen beo geændunge þæs | arleasen godes ƿiðersacan julianes.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 60r/16-18) Se þe leofeð ˥ rixeð mid | fæder ˥ halgen gaste on eallre ƿurlde ƿurld. | ameN

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Note
notes.body: cf. fols 48v/10-54v/2 above

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): (fol. 60r/18-19)iiii. kalendes septembris Passio Sancti Iohannis | baptiste.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): (fol. 60r/19-20) Misit herodes ˥ tenuit iohannem. | et reliqua.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 67r/21-23) To þan life us gelæde se mildheorte drihten | se leofeð ˥ rixeð mid fæder ˥ mid halge gaste. | abuten ænde. amen.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 67v/1) Se helend cƿæð on his godspelle.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 67v/20-21) 's'e byð ƿyrse þone | se deofel.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Note
notes.body: 'Final two sentences, partly differentiated through a coloured initial 'S' at fol. 67/17, drawn from Ælfric, CH I. 21' (Ker 1957, Item 209). Ker (1957) notes that this item has been added in a blank space, is 'perhaps [of] another hand', and that the last 5 lines (17-21) 'are not part of the homily'; they come instead from Ælfric, First Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies I]: Ascension. See Thorpe 1844-46, p. 304, ll. 4-5, and Clemoes 1997, p. 350, ll. 146-48. (Wilcox 2000).

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): (fol. 68r/1) Inxi. kalendas octobres. De Sancto Matheo apostolo.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 68r/2-3) Se godspellere matheus þe ƿe | todæig ƿurðigeð

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 70r/11-12) Sy | him þæs ƿuldor aa on ecnysse. Amen.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): (fol. 70r/13) Iniii. kalendas Octobres.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): (fol. 70r/14-15) Accesserunt ad iesum discipuli dicentes. Quis | putas maior est in regno coelorum. Et reliqua.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 70r/16-17) Ðiss dægðerlice godspell cƿyðð þæt drihtenes | leorningcnihtes

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 74v/10-11) ˥ þingere on heofone to þan aelmih | tigan gode. se þe leofeð ˥ rixeð a on ecnysse. amen.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 74v/12) Godes gecorene synd

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 74v/15) to bitere sarnysse.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Note
notes.body: The full homily occurs below beginning at fols 139r-145v, and these lines recur at fol. 143v/4-7.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 74v/16) Augustinus sæde on his cƿiðbocan þæt nan mann ne | mihte asmeagan godes ǽ.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 75r/5) sƿa sƿa he sylf cƿæð on his godspelle.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 75r/6-7) Iohannes se godspellere on his gastlican gesihðe | þone hælend geseh

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 75v/2) sƿa sƿa he sylf getæhte ær his þroƿunge

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 75v/3-4) Ðonne forme geaƿesdæig byð sunendæig.ʹ hit | byð god ƿinter.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 75v/20-21) ˥ ealle ƿæstmes yfeles geƿænde. scep | cƿelleð ˥ ealde mænn.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 76r/1-2) Hit sæigð on halgen bocan. þæt æfter gearan ymb | ryne

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 76v/17-18) byð sƿyðe mycle ungeðƿærnysse. ˥ ðrahlice ƿiten | on manna bearnen.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): (fol. 76v/18) Dominicaii. iN aduentu domini

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): (fol. 76v/19) Erunt signa in sole et luna. ˥ stellis. et Reliqua.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (76v/20-21) Se godspellere lucas aƿrat on þyssen dæigðer | licen godspelle.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 82v/5-8) for þy brucan þæs fyr | stes þe us god forgeaf. ˥ geearnigen þæt ece lif mid | him. se þe leofeð. ˥ rixeð on eallra ƿurlda ƿurld | ameN.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): (fol. 82v/10) Secundum matheum.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): (fol. 82v/10) Videns turbas iesus.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 82v/11-12) Ðæt halige godspell þe nu lyttle ær ætforan | eoƿ gerædd wæs.'

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 86v/21-23) scyppend ˥ alysend ealre | halgena mid fæder ˥ mid þan halgen gaste. a on ecnysse. | ameN.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Note
notes.body: Fol. 86v ruled for an extra line to complete this item.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 87r/1-2) Iohannes se godspellere aƿrat hƿu se hælend spæc to his | leorningcnihten. ˥ cƿæð.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 87v/7-8) ˥ eall þæt ge beseceð æt | mine fæder on minen name.ʹ eall ic hit do.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): (fol. 87v/9) De Resurrectione domini

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (87v/9-11) Ðæs dæiges þe ure | hælend for ure alesednysse geðolede pine on | þær halgen rode.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 100r/22) Seo drihtene lof.ʹ ˥ deofle sarege. ameN.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 100v/1-3) ON Tiberies dagen þæs mycele caseres hit ge | lamp binnen lyttle fæce æfter þan þe | crist ahangen ƿæs.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 102r/7-8) ˥ ƿyrðmynt fæder[?] | ˥ sune. ˥ þan halgen gaste. aa buten ænde. Amem.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 102r/9-10) On þan nexten fiftene dagen beforen domes | dæge.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 103v/9-9) sƿa þæt on mid | denearde ne belæfð naht unclænes gesene.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): (fol. 103v/9-10) Emb | þunre

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 103v/9) On Ianuarius monðe gyf hit þunreð.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 103v/23-24) On decembre. | hit bodeð god gear on tilðe. ˥ sibb. ˥ sehte.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Note
notes.body: The scribe has here written two extra lines to end this item at the end of this folio, which is the last in its quire.

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): (fol. 104r/1) De Scientia.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 104r/1-3) Ærest ealre þingen | æighƿylce mæn is to secene hƿæt seo se soðe ƿi | sedom.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 119r/18-19) his saƿle to for | ƿyrde on ecere pine.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Note
notes.body: Internal rubrics are in red and followed by coloured initials, alternately green and red.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 119r/21-22) Oft hƿonlice gelefde mænn smegeð mid | heora stunten gescade.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 123r/8-9) ˥ to þan ecen life gelæde. se þe leofeð | ˥ rixeð. abuten ænde. amen.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): (fol. 123r/8) Sanctus Furseus gesihðe.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 123r/9-10) Mæn þa leofeste. Paulus se apostel eallra | þeode larðeaƿ aƿrat beo him sylfen

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 130v/22) se þe is ealre leode ƿealdend.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): (fol. 131r/1) Of Drihtelme

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 131r/1-4) BEDA ure larðeaƿ aƿrat | on þære bech þe is gehaten historia | anglorum be sumes mannes æriste on þyssen | eglande.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 136r/12-14) on þan mæig æighƿa beo þyssen | genihtsumlice geheren se þe heo oferræden | ƿyle. gyf he þæt andgit understanden cann.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Note
notes.body: Doxology omitted, per Ker. Note that Ker (1957) makes two items of this one item, breaking the text at fol. 135r/15, when the manuscript shows no indication of a new textual item. We thus retain the single item numbering here, as Warner (1917 for 1915) item 38. Early Modern note, 'Liber Dialogorum gregory | Anglie habebat', at the foot of fol. 136r refers to the OE at fol. 136r/9-10.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 136r/15-16) God spæc to anen ƿitege þe ƿæs Ionas geha | ten.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 137r/6-7) for heora lehtren mid heofonlice fyre for | bærnde. sƿa sƿa þe eoƿ gereccen mugen.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 137r/8) Soð is to secgene. þa þa ƿyreceð on godes ƿille. | þa becumeð on myrhðe. Ðæt godspell | cweðð. Ælc þære þe forlæt.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 139r/1-2) ˥ geefenlæcen þan apostlen þæt ƿe mid heom and | mid gode þæt ece lif habben moten. Amen.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): (fol. 139r/3) Forbisne of Iob.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 139r/3-5) Mine gebroðre. ƿe rædeð | nu æt godes þenunge beo þan eadigen ƿere | Iob.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 145v/16-18) eallra his | ƿundra ˥ his ƿeldæden se þe ana is god a on | ecnysse. amen.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Note
notes.body: The entire text of a homily, a fragment of which is also included above at fol. 74v/12.

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): (fol. 145v/18) Of Seinte Neote.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 145v/19-20) Mæn þa leofeste. Ƿe ƿylleð eoƿ cyðen beo su | [?] men dæle emb þyssen halgen

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 151r/22-23) ˥ þæt ƿe moten æfter forðsiðe | to ecere reste becumen.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Note
notes.body: Rubric on fol. 145v is in green, unlike the red used in all other cases. The text is fitted onto fol. 151r through the addition of a half-line beneath the usual ruled space.

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): (fol. 151v/1) Sermo in festis Sancte Marie virginis.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 151v/2-4) Se godspellere Lucas sæigð on þyssen | godspelle. þæt se hælend com in to sumen | cæstele.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 158r/10-12) sohten urne drihten mid sme | rigeles inne his þruge þa þa he beby | riged ƿæs

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 158r/13-14) Ƿe rædeð on bocan þæt Nabugodonosor | geheregode ierusalem.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 159r/6-8) Mann sægð þæt fram þan time þe ærest Adam gescapen ƿæs. oððe christes tocyme. ƿæron | agane fif þusend. ˥ fif hundred ˥ fif ˥ | tƿentig geare.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Note
notes.body: 'Darius' at fol. 158r/20 and 158v/15 overwrites an erasure in a different hand; D tipped with green. At fol. 158r/20, 'Swa swa writen seggeþ' is written in a different hand in fading red ink. On fol. 159r/9, lines of Latin have been squeezed in, beginning 'cum sit nostra presens intentio'.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 159r/10) Sum mann sæigð þæt synne nis nan þing

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 163v/8) heo gebideð frofre ˥ blisse.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Note
notes.body: Condensed translation of Book 2, Chapters 1-6

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 163v/11-12) hƿy aƿas ure drihten /of deaðe\ þæs formeste dæges | þære ƿuca.ʹ

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 165r/12-13) feoƿertig dagen æfter | þær pine þe heo þoligeð under ante criste;

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Note
notes.body: Condensed translation of Book 1, Chapters 23-25.

notes.head: Hand
notes.body: Written in the hand of a minor scribe (see below).

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 165r/14-15) NE becymð nan mann | to godes rice buten he sy afondod.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 166r/8-10) þonne he mid soft | nesse ˥ mid yfele lusten geearnian þa ece tin | trege mid deofle on helle ƿite. aa.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Hand
notes.body: Fols 165v/1-166r/10 are in the hand of a minor scribe (see below); fol. 165r/14-22 is in the hand of another scribe.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 166r/12) SANCTUS Iohannes geseh ofer garseg | sƿylc hit an land ƿære.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 168r/21-23) crist us generige | þæt ƿe on ƿynne ƿunigen móte. mid þan þe leo | feð ˥ rixeð a bute ænde. Amen.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Note
notes.body: Known as the Homily on the Phoenix

notes.head: Hand
notes.body: In the hand of Scribe 3.

notes.head: Note
notes.body: A line is added to fol. 168r to complete the item on this leaf.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 168v/1-2) Sum æƿfest godes þeign ƿæs ge | haten zacharias.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 169r/20-21) ˥ tostenc | te þa modigan.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Hand
notes.body: In the hand of Scribe 3.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 169v/1-2) Se hælend cƿæð on his godspelle. Ic eam | weig

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 169v/21) Hit gelimpð gelomlice þone se mann

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Note
notes.body: Ends imperfectly.

notes.head: Note
notes.body: Part 2 of the manuscript is written in s. ix, and probably from Italy. Texts include extracts from the Meters of Boethius's Consolatio Philosophiae, Isidore, Synonyma: De lamentatioaone animæ peccatricis. English glosses, mostly in s. x.

notes.head: Addition
notes.body: S.Y.

notes.head: Note
notes.body: Ker (1957) notes that this mark may be s. xii. An Isidore text from Christ Church, Canterbury, now CUL Kk. 1. 28 has the same mark.

notes.head: Columns:
notes.body: Columns: 1

notes.head: Written Lines:
notes.body: Written Lines: 24

notes.head: Locus:
notes.body: Locus: Fols 1-24r

notes.head: Dimensions:
notes.body: Dimensions: 35mm x 27mm; written space

binding: Bound in s. xvii in brown and red leather with shield on front in gold tooling, with green leather on the spine. Number 691 at top, A at bottom. 'Homilies of Abbat AElfric, Saxon, etc.' written in a green square.
accompanying: Added flyleaves of a printed edition of a Latin text at the beginning and the end of the manuscript.

history.origin: Written in the South-East of England, almost certainly at Christ Church, in the period 1140-1160. The manuscript seems to show a gradual accumulation of texts over time, if alterations in the various hands' letter-forms are anything to go by, including the identification of the same or a very similar hand in a Christ Church charter of the same period (Treharne forthcoming).
history.provenance: Nothing is known of the manuscript's history, prior to its acquisition by Cotton, except that it seems to have been used by a female 'ancilla' (as noted above) by the later twelfth century. Further annotations and pen-trials show the manuscript was available for users, but little else can be deduced as yet. What is known is fully detailed in Wilcox (2000).
history.acquisition: Given to British Library as part of Cotton collection.

admin: Manuscript described by Elaine Treharne with the assistance of Orietta Da Rold, Zöe Enstone, Hollie Morgan, Owen Roberson, William Green and Takako Kato (2010; 2013).
